prompt: What is Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)?
completion: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) is a Government Scheme that provides crop insurance protection to farmers when notified crops are damaged due to natural calamities.
The PMFBY scheme was launched on 18th February 2016 by the honorable Prime Minister of India.

prompt: From which date the revamped PMFBY scheme has come into effect?
completion: The Scheme was revamped in February 2020 and made voluntary for all the farmers for participation.

prompt: Who are eligible to get benefits under the scheme?
completion: All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers cultivating notified crops in notified areas are eligible for crop insurance.

prompt: Who are not eligible to get benefits under the scheme?
completion: Farmers not cultivating notifed crops and farmer groups/collectives are not eligble. Visit- https://pmfby.gov.in for more details

Crop insurance is an important risk mitigation tool to protect financial losses of farmers from unforeseen natural calamities like hailstorm, drought, floods, cyclones, heavy and unseasonal rains, attack of disease and pests etc.

prompt: Why farmers should avail crop insurance?
completion: An adverse weather/climatic conditions can cause significant damage to standing crops such as heavy rains, floods, hailstones, cloudbursts, landslide and natural fire etc, causing damage to crop partially or wholly. It impacts our hard-working farmers severely, burdening them economically and socially. Therefore, it is imperative to provide economic and social security to the farmers so that they are protected from probable crop loss with the help of crop insurance.

prompt: What are the provisions under PMFBY/RWBCIS to help farmers?
completion: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) launched in 2016, aims at providing crop insurance protection to farmers, when notified crops are damaged due to unexpected natural calamities. Notified crops are the crops identified by the State Govts to be covered under crop insurance. Field crops like cereals, pulses and oilseeds are covered under PMFBY while horticulture crops mainly fruit, and vegetable crops are covered under Restructured Weather Based Crop Insurance Scheme (RWBCIS). The scheme offers very low premium rates for farmers to participate in the scheme.

prompt: Where do I get information about PMFBY/RWBCIS?
completion: Contact nearest Bank Branch, PACS, Common Service Centre (CSC), representative of the insurance company working in the area or local agriculture office at District/Block level for information and insurance of notified crops.  Visit National Crop Insurance Portal www.pmfby.gov.in to get more details.

prompt: Which category of farmers are eligible to enroll under PMFBY?
completion: All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers cultivating notified crops in notified areas are eligible for crop insurance. Under revamped scheme, enrolment has been made voluntary for all the farmers. Earlier, the loanee farmers were covered compulsorily, but now the farmers may join the scheme as per his/her willingness.
